study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether precooling the puncture site with ice reduces pain associated with arterial puncture.
results_summary: Subjects pretreated with ice reported significantly less pain compared to the control group, particularly in those naive to the procedure. Ice application was well tolerated, with only 3 subjects unable to endure the 3-minute application.
population_specificity: Out-patients with a physician order for an arterial blood gas (ABG) test.
effective_dosage: A plastic bag of ice applied to the wrist for 3 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the cost-effectiveness of 5-FU/SA versus cryotherapy for treating isolated hyperkeratotic actinic keratosis lesions in Spain.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be less cost-effective and less effective in terms of treatment success and quality-adjusted life years compared to 5-FU/SA. The cost for cryotherapy was €285, higher than 5-FU/SA at €266.
population_specificity: Patients with isolated hyperkeratotic actinic keratosis lesions in Spain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cryotherapy as part of a "single-visit screen and treat" approach for cervical cancer prevention in low- and middle-income countries.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be an effective treatment for screen-positive women without clinical evidence of cancer, contributing to cervical neoplasia and cancer prevention. The study highlighted its role in alternative screening approaches like VIA and HPV testing.
population_specificity: Women in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) undergoing cervical cancer screening.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy and TENS in treating quadriceps activation (QA) failure in patients with knee pathologies.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy, along with TENS, is one of the most successful treatments for increasing QA levels in patients with QA failure, likely by disinhibiting the motor-neuron pool of the quadriceps. However, it remains unclear whether cryotherapy is more effective than TENS for restoring QA levels.
population_specificity: Patients with knee pathologies experiencing quadriceps activation failure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy in managing central airway obstruction (CAO) as part of a multimodality approach.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be effective for immediate relief in severe CAO when used for cryorecanalization, but it is not suitable for acutely symptomatic cases due to its delayed effect, requiring follow-up bronchoscopy for debris removal.
population_specificity: Patients with malignant and nonmalignant central airway obstruction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the versatility and importance of rigid bronchoscopy (RB), including its adaptation of modern therapeutic tools like cryotherapy, for interventional pulmonologists and thoracic surgeons.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy's effects but mentions RB's role in adapting modern tools such as cryotherapy for treating central airway lesions and mechanical debulking of endobronchial lesions.
population_specificity: Interventional pulmonologists and thoracic surgeons.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review technical considerations and applications of chemical and thermal ablations, including cryotherapy, in hepatic oncology.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on cryotherapy, only mentioning a review of ablation technologies for liver tumors.
population_specificity: Patients with liver tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the technical aspects and clinical applications of cryotherapy as an adjunctive or rescue therapy for nonvariceal upper gastrointestinal bleeding.
results_summary: The abstract highlights cryotherapy as an emerging technique for endoscopic hemostasis but does not provide specific findings on its effectiveness compared to other methods. It positions cryotherapy among several innovative modalities for managing gastrointestinal hemorrhage.
population_specificity: Patients with nonvariceal upper gastrointestinal bleeding.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy, cosmetic outcome, and safety of photodynamic therapy (PDT) with cryotherapy and other treatments for primary basal cell carcinoma (BCC).
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant difference in complete clearance rate, 1-year recurrence rate, or 5-year recurrence rate between PDT and cryotherapy. However, PDT had a significantly better cosmetic outcome than cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with primary basal cell carcinoma (BCC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of focal cryotherapy for treating localized prostate cancer, comparing it to radical treatments in terms of cancer control and side effects.
results_summary: Focal cryotherapy showed biochemical disease-free survival rates of 71-93% in primary cases and 50-68% in salvage cases, with low rates of incontinence (0-3.6%) and moderate erectile dysfunction (0-42% in primary, 60-71% in salvage). Complications like recto-urethral fistula were rare.
population_specificity: Patients with primary localized prostate cancer or radio-recurrent (salvage) prostate cancer.
study_duration: Follow-up ranged from 9-70 months for primary cases and 3 years for salvage cases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of daylight-activated photodynamic therapy (DA-PDT) with cryotherapy or no treatment for cutaneous leishmaniasis.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used as a control treatment, but the abstract does not provide specific efficacy results for cryotherapy compared to DA-PDT or untreated lesions.
population_specificity: Patients with cutaneous leishmaniasis caused by Leishmania major or Leishmania tropica.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of imiquimod versus provider-administered treatments like cryotherapy for anogenital warts in non-immunocompromised adults.
results_summary: The study found very low-quality evidence that imiquimod did not significantly differ from cryotherapy in complete regression rates but had lower recurrence rates at six months and fewer local adverse reactions and pain.
population_specificity: Non-immunocompromised adults with anogenital warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of cryotherapy as an alternative treatment for infantile haemangioma (IH) in preterm infants, particularly for early-stage lesions (<10 mm).
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryotherapy may be an attractive alternative for preterm infants due to its lack of systemic side effects, but no specific efficacy data or outcomes are provided. The focus is on the limitations of current beta blocker treatments and the lack of data for preterm infants.
population_specificity: Preterm infants with infantile haemangioma (IH), particularly those with early-stage lesions (<10 mm).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of cryotherapy compared to topical clobetasol proprionate lotion in stimulating hair regrowth in patients with patchy alopecia areata.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed an 80% response rate in treated patches, slightly lower than the 91.5% response rate with clobetasol, but no significant difference was found between the two treatments. Complete recovery was not achieved in any patient, and patch diameter/duration inversely correlated with improvement rates.
population_specificity: Forty patients (older than 5 years) with patchy alopecia areata affecting less than 50% of the scalp.
effective_dosage: N2 jet cryotherapy once a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to document the effects of cryotherapy and other ablative therapies on benign and neoplastic prostate tissue.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that cryotherapy and other focal therapies may induce changes in the prostate, but it does not provide specific results regarding efficacy or safety. The focus is on the need to document these effects as new treatments are developed.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer (PCa) undergoing needle biopsies or surgical specimens.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the immediate effect of cryotherapy, alone and in combination with different TENS methods, on pain threshold and tolerance in healthy individuals.
results_summary: Cryotherapy alone significantly increased pain threshold and tolerance. When combined with burst TENS, it provided greater analgesia compared to other groups, suggesting a potentiating effect. No significant effect was found when cryotherapy was combined with conventional TENS.
population_specificity: 112 healthy women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of endoscopic therapies, including cryotherapy, in managing early-stage esophageal cancer compared to surgical resection.
results_summary: The study suggests that endoscopic therapies, including cryotherapy, offer equivalent survival rates and reduced morbidity but higher recurrence rates for early-stage esophageal cancer compared to surgical resection. Emerging data on efficacy and long-term outcomes are promising, though further research is needed.
population_specificity: Patients with early-stage esophageal cancer confined to the mucosa or submucosa.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether applying EMLA® cream prior to cryotherapy reduces the pain associated with the procedure.
results_summary: The study found no statistical difference in pain reduction between EMLA® cream and placebo, as measured by VAS scores. Subjects with multiple warts reported higher pain levels, but this did not influence EMLA® cream's therapeutic effect.
population_specificity: 64 subjects with plantar warts.
effective_dosage: A thick layer of EMLA® cream or placebo applied under occlusion for 60 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of cryotherapy, exercises, or both on quadriceps muscle function in patients with reconstructed ACLs and arthrogenic muscle inhibition.
results_summary: Patients who performed rehabilitation exercises immediately after cryotherapy showed greater strength gains (higher normalized maximal voluntary isometric contraction torques) compared to those who received cryotherapy or exercises alone. The effect size was large (Cohen d = 1.4) for the combined intervention.
population_specificity: 30 patients with reconstructed ACLs, at least 6 months post-surgery, and with measurable quadriceps arthrogenic muscle inhibition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of cryotherapy compared to other endoscopic ablative therapies for treating Barrett's esophagus.
results_summary: The study found no evidence demonstrating the benefit of cryotherapy for the endoscopic treatment of Barrett's esophagus. Cryotherapy was not shown to be effective compared to other ablation therapies like APC, MPEC, or radiofrequency.
population_specificity: 649 patients with Barrett's esophagus from 10 different studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the influence of cryotherapy (cold water immersion) on lower extremity running biomechanics in healthy males.
results_summary: Cold water immersion decreased peak propulsive and vertical ground reaction forces, decreased plantarflexion moments, increased hip flexion angle, and prolonged contact time during running, but none of these changes were linked to injury-related biomechanical patterns. The study concluded that cold water immersion appears safe prior to running activities.
population_specificity: 26 healthy male volunteers
effective_dosage: 20 minutes of cold water immersion at ~11°C

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy versus laser therapy for inducing depigmentation in generalized vitiligo patients.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be equally effective as laser therapy in inducing depigmentation (46.7% success rate after one treatment), with better results on the trunk and arms. Side-effects were limited to hyperpigmentation in the face.
population_specificity: 22 adults with generalized vitiligo.
effective_dosage: Not specified (number of treatments per test region varied up to four sessions, with 84.3% receiving one session).
study_duration: Not specified (retrospective study with varying treatment sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term outcomes of cryotherapy in combination with intravitreal bevacizumab for treating peripheral retinal capillary hemangioblastoma (RCH).
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with bevacizumab showed mixed results—one eye improved in vision, while another developed complications requiring additional surgery. Anatomic regression was observed in some cases.
population_specificity: 4 patients (5 eyes) with peripheral or juxtapapillary RCH presenting with exudative changes and visual loss.
effective_dosage: 2 intravitreal injections of bevacizumab (0.5 mg) alongside cryotherapy for peripheral RCH.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the outcomes and morbidities of salvage focal cryoablation for locally recurrent prostate cancer after radiotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that salvage focal cryoablation had biochemical disease-free survival rates of 95.3%, 72.4%, and 46.5% at 1, 3, and 5 years, respectively, with notable morbidities including rectourethral fistula (3.3%), urinary retention (6.6%), and incontinence (5.5%). Potency preservation was reported in 50% of previously potent patients.
population_specificity: Patients with biopsy-proven unilateral recurrent prostate cancer after radiotherapy (n=91).
study_duration: Follow-up from 2002 to 2012 (intervention duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of an argon gas-based cryotherapy system (Seednet) for treating keloid scars, including its impact on scar volume, recurrence, and pigmentation across various skin types.
results_summary: The study found a significant 62% volume reduction in keloid scars after 12 months, along with reduced pain and itching. However, 17% of scars recurred, and hypopigmentation was more common in non-Caucasian patients.
population_specificity: 25 patients with 30 keloid scars, including all Fitzpatrick skin types.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy, tolerability, and safety of cryosurgery versus low-dose 5-FU/SA topical solution in treating moderate/severe hyperkeratotic actinic keratoses.
results_summary: Cryosurgery showed a mean reduction of 5.7 lesions per patient by Day 98, with a 41.9% histological clearance rate, but had an 84.8% recurrence rate at 6-month follow-up. Adverse events were reported in 6.1% of cryosurgery patients, all being mild or moderate skin reactions.
population_specificity: Patients with histologically confirmed moderate/severe hyperkeratotic actinic keratoses on the face/forehead or bald scalp.
effective_dosage: Up to two cryosurgery treatments, 3 weeks apart.
study_duration: Up to 6 weeks (two treatments spaced 3 weeks apart).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the existing literature on focal therapy techniques, including cryotherapy, to assess their potential for treating small, low-grade prostate cancers with fewer side effects than radical therapies.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that cryotherapy and other focal therapies may achieve equivalent oncologic efficacy to radical surgery while avoiding its long-term side effects, based on early outcomes from recent clinical trials.
population_specificity: Patients with small, low-grade prostate cancers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy and prognostic factors of chemoreduction combined with topical cryotherapy for advanced intraocular retinoblastoma.
results_summary: Cryotherapy combined with chemoreduction showed a 38.9% rate of restored or maintained good vision and helped control tumor recurrence in 57.1% of cases. Tumor dimensions significantly reduced post-treatment, but adverse effects like hair loss and gastrointestinal reactions were common.
population_specificity: 17 children (22 eyes) with advanced intraocular retinoblastoma.
study_duration: 2~6 courses of chemoreduction (average 4.5±0.8 courses), with follow-up of 7 to 34 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if adding Caphosol(®) to oral cryotherapy (OC) provided additional protection against oral mucositis (OM) in patients undergoing high-dose chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in OM severity, oral pain, use of i.v. opioids, or total parenteral nutrition between the group receiving OC combined with Caphosol(®) and the group receiving OC alone. The combination showed no additional benefit over OC alone.
population_specificity: Patients aged ≥16 years scheduled for allogeneic stem cell transplantation.
effective_dosage: Not specified (OC administered from start to end of high-dose chemotherapy; Caphosol(®) from day 0 to day 21).
study_duration: OC administered during high-dose chemotherapy; Caphosol(®) for 21 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy and other techniques for preventing retinal detachment in eyes with asymptomatic retinal breaks or lattice degeneration.
results_summary: No trials met the inclusion criteria, so no conclusions could be drawn about the effectiveness of cryotherapy or other interventions for preventing retinal detachment. Current treatment recommendations are based on expert consensus rather than proven efficacy.
population_specificity: Individuals with asymptomatic retinal breaks or lattice degeneration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the clinical application, efficacy, safety, and future directions of cryoablation therapy for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
results_summary: Cryoablation is highly effective for local tumor control with an acceptable safety profile, comparable overall survival to radiofrequency ablation for tumors <5 cm, and advantages like larger and precise ablation zones.
population_specificity: Patients with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), particularly those with tumors <5 cm.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) in treating chronic lower back pain in elderly males.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant improvement in patients receiving WBC twice a week (Group A), but significant improvement was observed in patients receiving WBC daily (Group B), suggesting that frequent WBC is effective for lower back pain.
population_specificity: 80 males aged 65-77 with chronic lower back pain lasting more than 3 months.
effective_dosage: Group A: WBC twice a week; Group B: WBC daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as an invasive treatment option for hypertrophic and keloid scars, alongside other therapies.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is listed as one of several invasive treatment options for hypertrophic and keloid scars, which may be used alone or in combination with other therapies. The abstract emphasizes the need for regular patient re-evaluation to determine if additional treatment is warranted.
population_specificity: Patients with hypertrophic scars and keloids resulting from surgery, burns, trauma, or infection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of cryotherapy alone versus cryotherapy combined with oral zinc sulfate in treating vulvar warts.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in treatment response between cryotherapy alone and cryotherapy combined with zinc sulfate. However, relapse rates after 6 months were significantly lower in the combination therapy group.
population_specificity: Women aged 20-50 years with vulvar warts.
effective_dosage: Not specified for cryotherapy alone; combination therapy included 400 mg oral zinc sulfate.
study_duration: 8 weeks for combination therapy; duration for cryotherapy alone not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the refractive characteristics of adults with retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) who underwent cryotherapy ablation treatment as children, comparing outcomes between full-circumference (360 degrees) and partial retinal treatments.
results_summary: The study found that eyes treated with full-circumference cryotherapy had significantly thicker lenses and shallower anterior chambers compared to partially treated eyes, but no significant differences in spherical equivalent refraction, axial length, or corneal curvature radius.
population_specificity: 24 patients (46 eyes) aged 15-30 years, previously diagnosed with ROP and treated with cryotherapy ablation as children.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of oral cryotherapy on the severity of oral mucositis in patients undergoing myeloablative conditioning followed by bone marrow transplantation.
results_summary: Oral cryotherapy significantly reduced the incidence and severity of oral mucositis and decreased secondary complications. Combining cryotherapy with regular oral care improved its efficacy for prevention and management.
population_specificity: Patients receiving myeloablative conditioning followed by bone marrow transplantation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether cryotherapy (ice application) reduces postoperative pain and narcotic use in patients undergoing major open abdominal operations.
results_summary: Cryotherapy significantly reduced postoperative pain scores on days 1 and 3 and decreased narcotic use by 3.9 morphine equivalents on day 1, with no significant differences in secondary outcomes like hospital stay or complications.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing abdominal operations with midline incisions.
effective_dosage: Cryotherapy applied for a minimum of 24 hours in intervals dictated by patient preference.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of various treatments, including cryotherapy, for xanthoma disseminatum due to the lack of established treatments for this rare condition.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was attempted as a local treatment for xanthoma disseminatum, but the abstract does not provide specific outcomes for cryotherapy, only noting that various treatments had "various results" and none were particularly successful.
population_specificity: Patients with xanthoma disseminatum, a rare non-familial disorder of non-Langerhans cell origin.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the management options for lymphangioma, including cryotherapy, to determine the best individualized treatment approach.
results_summary: The study found no consensus on the optimal treatment for lymphangioma, including cryotherapy, and recommended individualized management based on lesion size, location, and complications.
population_specificity: Patients with lymphangioma, particularly in the cervicofacial region.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether anthropometric measures influence the magnitude of skin cooling following whole body cryotherapy (WBC).
results_summary: The study found that females experienced significantly greater skin cooling than males after WBC, and higher body fat percentage correlated with greater cooling. No other significant associations were observed.
population_specificity: 18 male and 14 female participants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of needling versus liquid nitrogen cryotherapy in treating pedal warts, specifically examining regression rates of primary and satellite warts.
results_summary: The study found that needling resulted in a significantly higher regression rate (64.7%) of primary pedal warts compared to cryotherapy (6.2%). However, needling did not significantly affect satellite warts or complete wart regression.
population_specificity: Patients with pedal warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether advanced cryotherapy devices provided superior pain control, early range of motion (ROM), and reduced postoperative bleeding/swelling compared to cold packs after knee arthroplasty.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in pain control, analgesic consumption, or most secondary outcomes between advanced cryotherapy and cold packs, except for reduced flexion at 6 weeks in the cryotherapy group. Advanced cryotherapy did not deliver superior early recovery benefits as hypothesized.
population_specificity: 116 patients (100 analyzed) undergoing knee arthroplasty.
effective_dosage: Not specified (continuous temperature cryotherapy vs. cold packs).
study_duration: Prolonged cryotherapy sessions (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the current rationale and anticipated outcomes of various treatment methods, including cryotherapy, for retinoblastoma.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the management methods for retinoblastoma but does not provide specific findings or outcomes related to its efficacy or safety.
population_specificity: Young children with retinoblastoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the techniques, preliminary results, and limitations of percutaneous ablation methods, including cryotherapy, for breast cancer treatment.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of the techniques for percutaneous ablation of breast cancer but does not provide specific results for cryotherapy alone. It concludes that these techniques raise many questions and issues needing further investigation.
population_specificity: Patients with early breast cancer (implied, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze factors influencing treatment decisions for localized prostate cancer, particularly the preference for cryotherapy among ethnic minority men.
results_summary: The study found that African American men were less likely to undergo surgery and more likely to choose radiation therapy, while Hispanic and Caucasian men often elected cryoablation or radical prostatectomy. The less invasive nature of cryoablation appeared to influence treatment choices, especially among African American men.
population_specificity: Ethnic minority men (African American, Hispanic) and Caucasian men with localized prostate cancer treated at a safety net hospital.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) on salivary steroid hormone profiles in rugby players after 2 and 14 consecutive sessions.
results_summary: WBC reduced cortisol and DHEA levels after just 2 sessions, and after 14 sessions, cortisol, DHEA, and estradiol levels decreased while testosterone increased, improving the testosterone-to-cortisol ratio. Most subjects showed hormone variations exceeding the critical difference, indicating significant effects.
population_specificity: 25 professional rugby players from the Italian National Team.
effective_dosage: 2 daily sessions of whole-body cryotherapy at -110° to -140°C.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the surgical management of rhegmatogenous retinal detachment in patients with acute syphilitic panuveitis, including the use of cryotherapy for a giant retinal tear.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used in one eye (9.1%) to treat a giant retinal tear, but the abstract does not provide specific outcomes or efficacy data for cryotherapy alone. The study primarily focused on combined surgical approaches.
population_specificity: Patients with acute syphilitic panuveitis who developed rhegmatogenous retinal detachment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the risk of HPV transmission among healthcare personnel performing cryotherapy and other treatments for genital warts.
results_summary: The study found no increased HPV prevalence in employees performing cryotherapy compared to those who did not, suggesting cryotherapy does not elevate HPV transmission risk. HPV 6 or 11 were not detected in any samples.
population_specificity: 287 employees at departments of dermato-venerology and gynaecology in Denmark.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the feasibility of randomizing men with recurrent radiation-resistant prostate cancer (RRPC) for treatment with androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) and salvage prostate cryoablation (SPC).
results_summary: The study found that patient recruitment was challenging, with only 7 out of 28 eligible patients agreeing to randomization, primarily due to unwillingness to be randomized. Cryotherapy centers successfully progressed through qualification, but equipoise between ADT and SPC was difficult to convey.
population_specificity: Men with recurrent radiation-resistant prostate cancer (RRPC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of various treatments, including cryotherapy, for non-genital warts.
results_summary: The study included cryotherapy among the interventions reviewed, but specific results for cryotherapy were not detailed in the abstract. The overall GRADE evaluation suggested varying levels of evidence for the interventions.
population_specificity: Immunocompetent individuals with non-genital warts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of cryotherapy versus 10% and 25% trichloroacetic acid for treating Verruca plana warts.
results_summary: Cryotherapy reduced the number of lesions similarly to trichloroacetic acid treatments but caused more adverse effects like erythema, pain, erosions, bullae, and hyperpigmentation. It was effective but less safe compared to 10% trichloroacetic acid.
population_specificity: Patients with Verruca plana warts.
effective_dosage: Liquid nitrogen spray applied for 5-10 seconds per lesion weekly until clearance.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the relative efficacy of cryotherapy against other treatments for mild to moderate actinic keratosis on the face and scalp.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be significantly better than placebo in achieving complete patient clearance, though it was less efficacious than BF-200 ALA and some imiquimod regimens.
population_specificity: Patients with mild to moderate actinic keratosis on the face and scalp.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as part of a comprehensive postoperative pain management strategy after knee surgery.
results_summary: The abstract suggests cryotherapy is a viable postoperative analgesia method, potentially aiding pain management and functional recovery, though specific efficacy data is not detailed. It is mentioned alongside other adjunctive modalities without comparative analysis.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing knee surgery, particularly those requiring postoperative pain management.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of local therapies, including cryotherapy, in achieving permanent local disease control and improved survival for patients with liver oligometastases from colorectal cancer.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that local therapies like cryotherapy can lead to permanent local disease control and improved survival in selected patients with oligometastatic liver lesions, though specific outcomes for cryotherapy alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with oligometastatic liver lesions from colorectal cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a single-freeze application with CO2 or N2O was noninferior to the standard double-freeze with N2O for cryotherapy treatment.
results_summary: A single freeze with N2O was noninferior to a double freeze on the anterior lip but not the posterior lip, while CO2 did not achieve sufficient necrosis depth for noninferiority compared to N2O double freeze. The posterior lip result was close to statistical significance, and CO2 showed shallower necrosis depth (~1 mm less) than N2O.
population_specificity: Sixty women undergoing hysterectomy for reasons other than cervical cancer or precancer.
effective_dosage: Not specified (freeze techniques: single/double with N2O or single with CO2).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and durability of cryotherapy among other endoscopic ablative techniques for treating dysplastic Barrett's esophagus and early adenocarcinoma.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy, along with other ablative techniques, is effective and safe for treating dysplastic Barrett's esophagus and early adenocarcinoma, though radiofrequency ablation (RFA) was noted as more effective and preferred for most cases.
population_specificity: Patients with dysplastic Barrett's esophagus and early adenocarcinoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review surgical management outcomes for iatrogenic rectourethral fistulas (RUFs) following prostate cancer treatments, including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy for prostate cancer is associated with a 5-9% incidence of RUFs, most of which require surgical intervention, with muscle transposition flap repairs showing high success rates for radiation-induced fistulas.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer patients who developed iatrogenic RUFs after treatments like cryotherapy, radiation therapy, or radical prostatectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the comparative efficacy and safety of cryotherapy versus other treatments for localized prostate cancer.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was associated with less gastrointestinal and genitourinary toxicity compared to radiotherapy (SUCRA: 99% and 77%, respectively). No treatment showed superiority in all-cause mortality after 5 years.
population_specificity: 7,350 men with localized prostate cancer from 21 randomized trials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adding an immunomodulating BSS-BSSG mixture to cryotherapy improves treatment outcomes for anogenital warts compared to cryotherapy alone.
results_summary: The study found that combining cryotherapy with the BSS-BSSG mixture resulted in higher complete response rates (30.2% vs. 18.3% at 3 months) and lesion-free rates (79.4% vs. 61.7% at 6 months) compared to cryotherapy alone, with a significant advantage in time until response.
population_specificity: 123 patients with anogenital warts.
effective_dosage: 20 mg sterol and 0.2 mg sterolin (BSS-BSSG mixture) alongside cryotherapy every 3 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the outcomes of various treatments, including cryotherapy, for relapsed actinic keratoses over 6 and 12 months post-remission.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was one of several treatments used, but the abstract does not isolate its specific efficacy. Hyperkeratotic lesions healed faster but relapsed more frequently by 6 months, and male patients showed higher recurrence rates regardless of treatment.
population_specificity: 182 patients with relapsed actinic keratoses, including those with a history of malignant skin diseases, treated at nine Italian dermatology centers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term safety and efficacy of the Cambridge prophylactic cryotherapy protocol in reducing retinal detachment risk in type 1 Stickler syndrome patients.
results_summary: The study found that prophylactic cryotherapy significantly reduced retinal detachment risk (7.4-fold lower in bilateral and 10.3-fold lower in unilateral treatment groups) with no significant long-term side effects.
population_specificity: 487 patients with type 1 Stickler syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the shift in treatment strategies for Retinopathy of Prematurity (ROP) from cryotherapy and laser to Anti-VEGF drugs, focusing on awareness and prevention efforts.
results_summary: The study noted a transition from cryotherapy and laser to Anti-VEGF drugs for ROP treatment, highlighting promising results but cautioning about the lack of long-term safety data. Workshops improved awareness and led to ROP's inclusion in India's blindness control program.
population_specificity: Preterm babies with Retinopathy of Prematurity (ROP) in India.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of cryotherapy, particularly in combination with intralesional antimony, for treating uncomplicated cutaneous leishmaniasis in returning travelers, while also assessing species-specific treatment guidelines.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy combined with intralesional antimony is recommended for uncomplicated cutaneous leishmaniasis, except for infections caused by L. guyanensis and L. braziliensis, where systemic treatment is preferred. The efficacy was based on pooled data from multiple studies, though some clinical categories lacked sufficient evidence.
population_specificity: Returning travelers with parasitologically confirmed cutaneous leishmaniasis caused by various Leishmania species.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of topical potassium hydroxide versus cryotherapy for treating genital warts in immunocompetent, sexually active men.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found to be effective but had more prevalent side effects like local pain and post-treatment hypopigmentation compared to potassium hydroxide. The study concluded that potassium hydroxide was at least as effective as cryotherapy with a better safety profile.
population_specificity: Immunocompetent, sexually active men with genital warts.
study_duration: 10 months (enrollment period; exact treatment duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare clinical outcomes of "ideal" vs "nonideal" postprostatectomy stress urinary incontinence (PPI) patients who underwent male sling placement, with a focus on excluding patients with a history of cryotherapy in the ideal group.
results_summary: The study did not directly assess cryotherapy's effects but noted that patients with a history of cryotherapy were excluded from the "ideal" cohort, suggesting it may negatively impact outcomes for male sling procedures.
population_specificity: Postprostatectomy stress urinary incontinence (PPI) patients undergoing male sling placement.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the recurrence rates and cosmetic outcomes of cryotherapy with other treatments for basal cell carcinoma (BCC).
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy is a suitable alternate treatment option for appropriately selected primary low-risk BCC lesions, though surgical methods remain the gold standard. No specific adverse effects or recurrence rates for cryotherapy were detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with primary low-risk basal cell carcinoma lesions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of focal therapies like cryotherapy as interventions for localized prostate cancer to reduce adverse effects compared to whole-gland treatments.
results_summary: The study proposes a novel cohort-embedded RCT to assess cryotherapy and other focal therapies, suggesting composite outcomes measuring salvage therapy rates at 3-5 years as primary endpoints. It highlights the need for further research to establish efficacy compared to traditional treatments.
population_specificity: Men with clinically significant localized prostate cancer (PSA ≤ 15-20 ng/ml, Gleason grade ≤ 4 + 4 or ≤ 4 + 3, stage ≤ cT2cN0M0).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the 12-month primary patency rates of various endovascular devices, including cryotherapy, for treating femoropoliteal disease.
results_summary: The study found that cryoballoon therapy had a 12-month primary patency rate of 60.7%, which was lower than some other devices like drug-eluting stents (84%) but higher than LASER atherectomy (51.1%). The variation in study designs and patient populations limits direct comparisons between devices.
population_specificity: Patients with femoropoliteal disease (superficial femoral artery or popliteal artery involvement).

study_goal: The researchers were evaluating the role of high-intensity focused ultrasound (HIFU) as a focal therapy for localized prostate cancer, with cryotherapy mentioned as an additional radical therapy option.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about cryotherapy, focusing instead on HIFU's promising early oncological results and preservation of quality of life and potency.
population_specificity: Patients with localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy following anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) reconstruction through a systematic review of randomized and quasi-randomized clinical trials.
results_summary: Cryotherapy, specifically cold compression devices, significantly reduced pain scores 48 hours after surgery compared to no cryotherapy, with no difference in adverse events between treated and untreated patients. However, evidence was insufficient to draw definitive conclusions on other outcomes like edema, knee function, or quality of life.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent ACL reconstruction (573 participants across 10 trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and efficacy of a triple combination cream as an adjuvant to cryotherapy for treating solar lentigines and preventing post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation.
results_summary: The study found that the triple combination cream enhanced the resolution of solar lentigines and significantly reduced melanin levels and lentigines count. Adverse reactions included erythema and residual blisters from cryotherapy, but the cream was well-tolerated and did not increase side effects.
population_specificity: 50 patients with solar lentigines on the hands dorsum.
effective_dosage: Triple combination cream (fluocinolone acetonide 0.01%, hydroquinone 4%, tretinoin 0.05%) applied daily for 2 weeks pre-treatment and 3 weeks post-cryotherapy.
study_duration: 2 weeks pre-treatment, cryotherapy, 3 weeks recovery, and 8 weeks follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical outcomes of cryotherapy, among other treatments, in pediatric Coats' disease, focusing on visual and anatomic improvements.
results_summary: Cryotherapy, when combined with intravitreal bevacizumab, showed anatomic improvement in most cases but carried a risk of vitreoretinal traction and tractional retinal detachment in severe exudative retinal detachment cases. Visual improvement or stabilization was noted in the majority of treated eyes.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with Coats' disease in Taiwan.
study_duration: Mean follow-up was 40.50 ± 20.52 months (range: 14 to 72 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether performing CTI ablation simultaneously with PVI using separate cryogenerators is more efficient than sequential cryotherapy and RF energy ablation.
results_summary: The study found that performing CTI ablation with cryotherapy simultaneously with PVI significantly reduced procedure and fluoroscopy durations compared to sequential RF ablation, with similar clinical outcomes and no complications reported. All veins were successfully isolated, and bidirectional CTI block was achieved in nearly all cases.
population_specificity: 25 consecutive patients with clinical indications for both PVI and CTI ablation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the influence of cryotherapy on postural sway in healthy males, particularly when the whole lower limb is immersed.
results_summary: Cryotherapy increased postural sway (COP standard deviation and velocity) in the medial-lateral direction during bipedal conditions and increased COP velocity in both anterior-posterior and medial-lateral directions during unipedal conditions, suggesting caution before engaging in challenging postural control activities.
population_specificity: Healthy males
effective_dosage: Immersion in cold water at ∼11°C for 20 minutes

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy in treating actinic keratoses (AK) as part of a broader analysis of therapeutic options for everyday dermatological practice.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was included as one of the treatment options in a pragmatic algorithm for AK management, suggesting it is considered effective for certain clinical situations, particularly based on the number and nature of AK lesions. The study did not provide specific efficacy data for cryotherapy but endorsed its use within a broader treatment framework.
population_specificity: French dermatologists and their patients with actinic keratoses.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and applicability of cryotherapy for treating oral precancers (OL, OVH) and cancers (OVC, OSCC).
results_summary: Cryotherapy effectively treats OL with promising results and can be used for OVH and OVC when combined with shave excision. It is less mainstream for OSCC but suitable for plaque-type lesions like OL.
population_specificity: Patients with oral precancers (OL, OVH) and cancers (OVC, OSCC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to quantify the magnitude and persistence of vasoconstriction caused by cryotherapy and assess its potential link to nonfreezing cold injury (NFCI).
results_summary: Cryotherapy induced significant vasoconstriction across all tested devices, with reduced blood flow persisting even after rewarming, suggesting a risk for NFCI due to prolonged ischemia.
population_specificity: Not specified (implied general soft tissue injury patients).
effective_dosage: Not specified (four FDA-approved cryotherapy devices tested).
study_duration: Not specified (measured during baseline, cooling, and rewarming periods).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare practice patterns, mortality outcomes, and costs between salvage cryotherapy (SCT) and salvage radical prostatectomy (SRP) in men who failed primary radiation therapy for prostate cancer.
results_summary: The study found that SCT was associated with lower overall mortality (21.6 vs. 6.1 deaths/100 person years) and a trend toward lower prostate cancer-specific mortality (6.5 vs. 1.4 deaths/100 person years) compared to SRP, along with significantly lower Medicare expenditures ($8,088 vs. $19,543).
population_specificity: 440 men who failed primary radiation therapy for prostate cancer, with 341 undergoing SCT and 99 undergoing SRP.
study_duration: Median time from primary radiotherapy to salvage therapy was 38.7 months for SCT and 55.8 months for SRP.

study_goal: The researchers compared the outcomes of complications (bladder neck contractures, urethral strictures) following different prostate cancer treatments, including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that complications following cryotherapy were more extensive, harder to treat, and associated with worse outcomes and slower recovery compared to radical prostatectomy. Treatment options varied from minimally invasive to complex surgical reconstruction.
population_specificity: Patients with localized prostate cancer experiencing complications like bladder neck contractures or urethral strictures.

study_goal: The study aimed to determine the safety and efficacy of isotretinoin for recalcitrant facial flat warts, not Cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study did not evaluate Cryotherapy's effects; it focused on isotretinoin's efficacy for facial flat warts.
population_specificity: Patients with recalcitrant facial flat warts (treated for at least 3 years with other therapies, including Cryotherapy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of a novel biopsy technique ("curopsy") versus traditional curettage (with or without adjuvants like cryotherapy) in treating primary aneurysmal bone cysts (ABCs).
results_summary: Curopsy resolved ABCs in 81% of cases, with a shorter healing time but higher recurrence rate (18.6%) compared to curettage (10.2%). Both methods had similar complication rates.
population_specificity: Patients with primary aneurysmal bone cysts (excluding those with pathologic fractures or seeking second opinions).
study_duration: Mean healing time: 9.6 weeks (curopsy) vs. 11.4 weeks (curettage); median follow-up: 14 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to verify the efficacy of combining cryotherapy with laser therapy in reducing the severity of oral mucositis (OM) in patients undergoing melphalan chemotherapy followed by hematopoietic stem-cell transplantation (HSCT).
results_summary: The cryotherapy/laser therapy group showed the lowest OM scores (maximum Grade I) and the fewest days with OM (8 days) compared to the laser-only and control groups (p < 0.001). Severe OM (Grades III and IV) was only frequent in the control group, demonstrating the effectiveness of the combined therapy.
population_specificity: HSCT patients treated with melphalan chemotherapy (n = 71, with additional control group n = 33).
effective_dosage: Oral cryotherapy with ice chips for 1 hour 35 minutes followed by low-level laser therapy (InGaAIP, 660 nm, 40 mW, 6 J/cm²).
study_duration: OM scores and clinical information were collected from D0 to D+11.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of cryotherapy as a disinhibitory intervention for improving voluntary quadriceps activation in individuals with knee injury.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed moderate immediate effects in improving voluntary quadriceps activation (effect size d = 0.76; 95% CI = -0.13, 1.59), though the confidence interval includes zero, indicating some uncertainty in the effect. It was less effective than transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation but more effective than manual therapy.
population_specificity: Individuals with decreased voluntary quadriceps activation, commonly associated with knee injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether different lengths of whole body cryotherapy (WBC) exposure induce differential changes in inflammatory markers, tissue oxygenation, skin and core temperature, thermal sensation, and comfort.
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in IL-6 or core temperature but reported significant reductions in deoxyhaemoglobin, oxyhaemoglobin, tissue oxygenation index, skin temperature, thermal sensation, and comfort. A 2-minute WBC exposure was identified as optimal.
population_specificity: Fourteen male professional first-team Super League rugby players.
effective_dosage: 1, 2, and 3 minutes of WBC at -135°C, each exposure separated by seven days.
study_duration: Three exposures, each separated by one week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of long-pulsed neodymium:yttrium-aluminum-garnet (LP-Nd:YAG) treatment for refractory warts in hands and feet.
results_summary: The study found that LP-Nd:YAG treatment achieved complete clearance of refractory warts in 56% of patients after 24 weeks, with no scarring, post-hyperpigmentary changes, or serious adverse events reported. Histological evaluation showed coagulation and destruction of wart tissue and blood vessels.
population_specificity: 20 subjects (11 male, nine female) with refractory warts in periungual/subungual areas, plantar areas, fingers, and/or toes, who had failed conventional treatments for over 6 months.
effective_dosage: Up to six sessions at 4-week intervals, with fluence of 150-185 J/cm², spot size of 5 mm, and pulse duration of 15 msec.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if preoperative cryotherapy combined with a postoperative treatment plan reduces pain and narcotic use compared to a postoperative plan alone after ACL reconstruction.
results_summary: Patients receiving preoperative cryotherapy reported significantly lower pain scores and used fewer narcotics in the first 36 hours post-surgery, with no significant differences in other outcomes like knee flexion or complications.
population_specificity: 53 patients undergoing arthroscopically assisted ACL reconstruction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and patient acceptability of cryotherapy versus visual LEEP in treating VIA-positive cervical lesions in a low-resource setting.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy and visual LEEP had similar efficacy in treating VIA-positive lesions, with comparable rates of persistent VIA positivity, procedure duration, complication-related clinic visits, and patient acceptability. Both methods were effective in a see-and-treat approach for cervical cancer prevention.
population_specificity: Women with VIA-positive cervical lesions in rural southeast Nigeria.
effective_dosage: Not specified (cryotherapy administered with nitrous oxide).
study_duration: Single session with follow-up at 6 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of CO2 laser ablation and cryotherapy in treating isolated actinic keratosis (AK) lesions on the face and scalp.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a higher complete remission rate (78.2%) compared to CO2 laser ablation (72.4%) at 3 months, with thicker lesions responding significantly better to cryotherapy. At 12 months, cryotherapy maintained higher remission rates (53 patients) compared to laser ablation (14 patients).
population_specificity: Patients with isolated (≤4) actinic keratosis lesions on the face and scalp.
study_duration: 90 days (3 months) for initial assessment, with follow-up at 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the functional and oncologic results of various energy modalities, including cryotherapy, for focal therapy in prostate cancer.
results_summary: Cryotherapy demonstrated short-term effectiveness with low morbidity and was noted as a reversible therapy, though it requires sophisticated and expensive equipment.
population_specificity: Patients with prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of cryotherapy for managing chronic epistaxis in a patient with hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (HHT).
results_summary: Cryotherapy successfully managed symptoms of frequent, severe epistaxis in an HHT patient with no associated complications, suggesting it as a viable treatment option.
population_specificity: A patient with hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (HHT) and a 10-year history of frequent, severe epistaxis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to estimate the incidence and variability of HPV infection in women following treatment for cervical neoplasia, including cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy was one of several treatments used, with HPV incidence post-treatment varying widely (0-47%). Lower HPV incidence was associated with specific factors, but cryotherapy-specific efficacy was not isolated.
population_specificity: Women treated for cervical neoplasia, mean age 31-43 years.
study_duration: Follow-up ranged from 1.5 to 36 months (median 6 months).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the quality of clinical practice guidelines (CPGs) for non-pharmacological management of osteoarthritis (OA) and summarize recommendations, including cryotherapy, from high-quality CPGs.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was commonly recommended for non-pharmacological management of OA by high-quality CPGs, though the interventions addressed varied and were superficially covered in more than half of the selected CPGs. The overall quality of the included CPGs was moderate (4.8 ± 0.41 on a 7-point scale).
population_specificity: Individuals with osteoarthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the depth of injury and effects of liquid nitrogen spray cryotherapy on the human esophagus in subjects with esophageal neoplasia before planned esophagectomy.
results_summary: Mucosal destruction was highly effective (93-95%) in both treatment groups, with deeper injury observed in the group receiving longer spray times (5.4 mm vs. 4.0 mm). No serious adverse events or perforations occurred.
population_specificity: Seven males with esophageal carcinoma scheduled for esophagectomy.
effective_dosage: Group 1: four cycles of 10 s each; Group 2: two cycles of 20 s each.
study_duration: Cryoablation performed seven days before esophagectomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cryotherapy with other treatment options for external genital warts (EGWs) in terms of efficacy, patient preferences, and practical considerations.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is listed as a provider-administered therapy for EGWs, but the abstract does not provide specific efficacy data for cryotherapy alone. It notes that recurrence is common with or without treatment and that treatment choice depends on patient needs, lesion characteristics, and provider expertise.
population_specificity: Patients with external genital warts (EGWs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe a case of cryotherapy-induced milia en plaque and review the literature on cryotherapy-induced milia and its complications.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy-induced milia en plaque is a benign condition that may develop after cryotherapy, with lesions potentially resolving spontaneously. The condition is postulated to be an example of Wolf's isotopic response.
population_specificity: A man treated with cryotherapy for actinic keratosis on his dorsal hand.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of cryotherapy (frozen gel gloves) in reducing docetaxel-induced hand and fingernail toxicities.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in toxicity between gloved and non-gloved hands, with a high withdrawal rate (60%) due to patient discomfort. Cryotherapy was deemed safe but showed limited efficacy in reducing toxicities.
population_specificity: Patients prescribed docetaxel every 3 weeks for a minimum of three cycles (n=53, with 21 providing evaluable data).
effective_dosage: Frozen gel gloves worn for 15 min pre-infusion, during infusion, and 15 min post-infusion.
study_duration: Minimum of three cycles (each cycle every 3 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current evidence on the therapeutic and biological effects of cryotherapy in inflammatory rheumatic diseases, particularly rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy significantly reduced pain and disease activity in RA patients. It also suggested potential molecular pathways by which cryotherapy might reduce joint inflammation and destruction, though more research is needed.
population_specificity: 257 rheumatoid arthritis (RA) patients (non-operated and non-infected).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of intralesional cryotherapy versus excision combined with corticosteroids or brachytherapy for treating primary and therapy-resistant keloids, focusing on patient-reported outcomes and scar assessment.
results_summary: The study evaluates cryotherapy's impact using the POSAS scale, recurrence rates, volume reduction, and QoL measures, with follow-ups at multiple intervals, but specific results are not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients with primary or therapy-resistant keloids.
study_duration: Follow-up assessments at 2, 12, 26, and 52 weeks postoperatively.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and feasibility of cryotherapy as a treatment for precancerous cervical lesions when linked with visual inspection screening methods (VIA/VILI) in low-resource settings.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy is well-tolerated with no significant side effects or complications, and it can be feasibly linked to visual inspection screening methods for precancerous lesions in a single-visit approach, though this may lead to overtreatment.
population_specificity: Women in sub-Saharan Africa at risk for cervical cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the influence of whole-body cryotherapy (WBC) on improving spine activity and reducing chronic lower back pain in elderly men.
results_summary: The group using WBC showed significantly lower active potentials of erector spinae muscles and a significant increase in lumbar spine mobility compared to the exercise-only group.
population_specificity: 96 male participants aged 65-75 years with chronic lower back pain lasting >3 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the proper technique and use of cryotherapy as an alternative treatment for cervical intraepithelial lesions (CIN) compared to LEEP.
results_summary: The abstract highlights cryotherapy as a viable option for treating CIN due to its ease of use, minimal complications, and cost-effectiveness, though LEEP remains the preferred treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with cervical intraepithelial lesions (CIN) following an abnormal Pap test.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness and safety of alternative surgical treatments, including cryotherapy, for cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN).
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in treatment failures (persistent disease) among various surgical techniques, including cryotherapy. Cryotherapy was comparable to other methods in efficacy, though large loop excision of the transformation zone (LLETZ) provided more reliable histology specimens with lower morbidity.
population_specificity: Women with cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to demonstrate that surgical removal of the inferior turbinate mucosa with a microdebrider, rather than cryotherapy, results in full restoration of mucosal structure and function.
results_summary: The study found that partial turbinoplasty with a microdebrider improved nasal airflow and restored normal mucosal function within 4 months, but did not evaluate cryotherapy.
population_specificity: Thirteen symptomatic adult patients with chronic rhinitis and inferior turbinate hypertrophy.
study_duration: Follow-up until complete mucosal regeneration (4 months)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of cryotherapy and laser therapy in treating cutaneous melanoma metastases, with a focus on cryotherapy's regional effects and recurrence rates.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed good results in ablating cutaneous melanoma metastases, though with less literature support compared to laser therapy. Some evidence suggests a regional effect with reduced recurrence at treated sites, warranting further investigation.
population_specificity: Patients with cutaneous melanoma metastases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of photodynamic therapy (PDT) with different concentrations of aminolevulinic acid (ALA) for treating recalcitrant facial verruca plana, not cryotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that 10% ALA-PDT had better efficacy and safety than 5% or 20% concentrations, with higher complete response rates and lower hyperpigmentation incidence. Cryotherapy was mentioned as a poorly responding treatment option but was not the focus of the study.
population_specificity: Patients with generalized recalcitrant facial verruca plana.
effective_dosage: 5%, 10%, and 20% ALA concentrations, irradiated with 633-nm red light for 339 J/cm².

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the molecular responses and optimization strategies for cryosurgical treatment of tumors, considering the complex biology of cancer and its implications for therapy.
results_summary: The study highlights that cryosurgery's success is comparable to other cancer therapies but emphasizes the need for optimization due to cancer's organized tissue structure, stem cell resistance, and dependency on supporting cells. It discusses adjunctive therapies and strategies to improve cryoablation efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with diverse cancers (specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current endoscopic therapies, including cryoablation, for Barrett's esophagus and early esophageal cancer, focusing on ideal candidates, treatment modalities, and clinical outcomes.
results_summary: The abstract summarizes that cryoablation is among the endoscopic treatments discussed, but specific findings on its effects are not detailed. The review covers clinical and safety outcomes broadly without focusing on cryotherapy alone.
population_specificity: Patients with Barrett's esophagus and early esophageal cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of cryotherapy on non-metastatic invasive squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) of the skin, focusing on recurrence rates and comparative effectiveness with other treatments.
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed the lowest pooled recurrence rate (0.8%) among the treatments studied, indicating high efficacy for small, low-risk SCC lesions. The recurrence rate was significantly lower than other modalities like photodynamic therapy (26.4%) and comparable to curettage and electrodesiccation (1.7%).
population_specificity: Patients with primary, non-metastatic, invasive SCC of the skin, predominantly small, low-risk lesions.
study_duration: Variable follow-up periods (not explicitly stated for cryotherapy alone)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the virus clearance rate, wart cure rate, and safety of five treatments, including cryotherapy, for condylomata acuminata (CA) based on lesion size.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was found effective when combined with ALA-PDT for lesions 0.5-2.0 cm and as a pretreatment for larger lesions (>2.0-4.0 cm) before ALA-PDT retreatment. The study did not report specific adverse effects or safety concerns for cryotherapy alone.
population_specificity: 361 patients diagnosed with condylomata acuminata, grouped by lesion size (<0.5 cm, 0.5-2.0 cm, >2.0-4.0 cm).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review surgical aspects of prostate cancer management, including patient selection, nerve-sparing techniques, and outcomes, with a brief mention of surgical ablative therapies like Cryotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings on Cryotherapy, focusing instead on broader surgical management of prostate cancer.
population_specificity: Men with localized prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review and provide treatment recommendations for tegumentary leishmaniasis, including the role of cryotherapy as a local therapy option.
results_summary: Cryotherapy is highlighted as a good local treatment option for cutaneous leishmaniasis with less systemic toxicity compared to systemic treatments, particularly in Old World CL cases where spontaneous healing can occur.
population_specificity: Patients with tegumentary leishmaniasis (cutaneous and mucocutaneous leishmaniasis) in various geographic regions, particularly Afghanistan, Brazil, Iran, Peru, Saudi Arabia, and Syria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy as a treatment for nonmelanoma skin cancer (NMSC) compared to surgical modalities.
results_summary: The study found that cryotherapy aggressive enough to treat NMSC results in poor cosmetic outcomes and adverse effects, negating its usefulness despite some efficacy. It is not as effective as surgery and is not a first-line therapy for NMSC.
population_specificity: Patients with nonmelanoma skin cancer (NMSC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare cryotherapy with other treatments for actinic keratosis, evaluating its role in preventing malignant transformation.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several treatment options for actinic keratosis, each with advantages and disadvantages, but does not provide specific results for cryotherapy alone.
population_specificity: Patients with actinic keratosis (general dermatologic population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current literature on treatment options for keloid disease, including cryotherapy, to provide a structured management approach.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several treatment modalities used in clinical practice for keloid disease, but notes a lack of robust randomized controlled trials evaluating its efficacy. Combination therapies, which may include cryotherapy, have shown some benefit.
population_specificity: Individuals with keloid disease, particularly those with dark, pigmented ethnic skin (African, Asian, and Hispanic descent).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of focal salvage therapy, including cryotherapy, as a less morbid alternative for treating localized recurrent prostate cancer after failed radiotherapy.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that cryotherapy is a current option for salvage therapy but carries significant morbidity, and new focal approaches may reduce tissue damage and morbidity by targeting only the recurrent area.
population_specificity: Men with localized recurrent prostate cancer after failed radical external beam radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether cryoablation of small renal tumors could facilitate laparoscopic partial nephrectomy (LPN) without increasing procedure morbidity or compromising surgical and oncological outcomes.
results_summary: The study found that cryoablation followed by LPN was feasible with no intra-operative complications or conversions, though it resulted in longer operative times. Pathological findings showed early cryoablation effects but viable tissue, and one patient developed a pararenal abscess postoperatively.
population_specificity: 16 patients with peripherally located small renal tumors (mean age 68 years) and a matched-pair cohort of 41 patients for retrospective comparison.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effectiveness of conservative treatment modalities, including cryotherapy, for retinoblastoma in preserving vision and avoiding enucleation.
results_summary: Cryotherapy, when used alone or in combination with other treatments, can help salvage useful vision and reduce the need for enucleation or external beam radiotherapy. The abstract suggests it is among the effective conservative modalities for retinoblastoma.
population_specificity: Children with retinoblastoma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of cryotherapy as part of conservative treatment approaches for common tendon injuries, alongside other biophysical modalities.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as a conservative treatment option for tendon injuries but does not provide specific results on its effectiveness. It highlights the general challenge of poor natural healing in tendon and ligament injuries and the need for improved regenerative approaches.
population_specificity: Patients with common tendon injuries (rotator cuff, flexor tendon, Achilles tendon).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the challenges of managing dermatologic adverse events (AEs) in oncology patients, including the role of cryotherapy as part of a multifaceted treatment approach.
results_summary: The abstract notes that cryotherapy is one of several modalities used to manage dermatologic AEs in cancer patients, but data on its effectiveness is largely anecdotal due to a lack of focused clinical trials.
population_specificity: Patients with gastrointestinal malignancies experiencing dermatologic adverse events from targeted therapies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of combined cryoultrasound therapy versus cryotherapy alone for chronic plantar fasciitis resistant to other treatments.
results_summary: Both cryoultrasound therapy and cryotherapy were effective, but cryoultrasound showed statistically significant greater pain reduction at all follow-ups (3, 12, and 18 months) and higher effectiveness index scores.
population_specificity: 102 patients with chronic plantar fasciitis, heel spurs, pain >5 on VAS for ≥6 months, and prior treatment failure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the indications, contraindications, and practical considerations of endobronchial ablative therapies, including cryotherapy, for treating malignant and benign airway lesions.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that cryotherapy, among other endobronchial ablative therapies, can provide significant symptom improvement, enhanced quality of life, and improved life expectancy for patients with symptomatic airway lesions. However, specific outcomes or comparative efficacy of cryotherapy alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with malignant and benign airway lesions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze factors influencing local recurrence in giant cell tumors of bone treated with curettage, including the role of adjuvant treatments like cryotherapy.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used as a local adjuvant treatment in 20.2% of cases, but the study found no significant association between adjuvant treatments (including cryotherapy) and local recurrence risk. High-quality curettage techniques were emphasized as more critical for preventing recurrence.
population_specificity: Patients with giant cell tumors of the appendicular skeleton treated by intralesional curettage.
study_duration: Mean follow-up was 6 years and 11 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review salvage treatment options, including cryotherapy, for intraprostatic relapse after radiotherapy failure in prostate cancer patients.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as one of several local salvage treatment options for intraprostatic relapse, but does not provide specific efficacy or outcome data for cryotherapy alone.
population_specificity: Prostate cancer patients with intraprostatic relapse after primary external-beam radiotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness and safety of cryotherapy versus potassium hydroxide (KOH) for treating molluscum contagiosum (MC).
results_summary: Cryotherapy showed a 93.3% complete response rate, with 6.7% partial response, and no statistically significant difference compared to KOH. Postinflammatory hyperpigmentation was more common with cryotherapy.
population_specificity: 30 patients aged 1-24 years with molluscum contagiosum.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as a treatment modality for retinal vasoproliferative tumors, particularly in cases requiring intervention.
results_summary: The study mentions cryotherapy as one of several effective treatment options for retinal vasoproliferative tumors, alongside lasers, surgical excision, radiation, and antiangiogenic intravitreal injections. No specific outcomes or comparative efficacy data for cryotherapy are provided.
population_specificity: Patients with retinal vasoproliferative tumors, either idiopathic or secondary to other ocular diseases.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to validate the oncologic outcomes of salvage cryotherapy (SCT) in radiation recurrent prostate cancer (RRPC) and identify parameters associated with increased risk of micturition symptoms.
results_summary: The study found that nadir post-SCT PSA levels strongly correlated with disease-free survival (DFS), with better outcomes for PSA ≤1 ng/ml. Physical parameters like prostate gland and iceball lengths were significantly associated with post-SCT micturition symptoms.
population_specificity: 283 consecutive patients with radiation recurrent prostate cancer (RRPC) treated in three U.K. centers between 2001 and 2011.
effective_dosage: Two freeze-thaw cycles of transperineal cryotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of cryotherapy as an adjuvant treatment for conjunctival melanoma, focusing on its effectiveness in improving patient outcomes.
results_summary: The study mentions cryotherapy as part of the standard adjuvant treatment for conjunctival melanoma, but no specific efficacy data or outcomes related to cryotherapy alone are provided. The rarity of the tumor limits controlled trials to define the best treatment modality.
population_specificity: White adults with conjunctival melanoma, often originating from primary acquired melanosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of conventional gel-pack cryotherapy versus computer-controlled cryotherapy in reducing knee temperatures after ACL reconstructive surgery.
results_summary: Computer-controlled cryotherapy showed significantly lower skin and subcutaneous tissue temperatures after 4 hours compared to gel-packs, with more effective and controllable energy extraction. No significant differences were observed in the first 2 hours of treatment.
population_specificity: 20 patients post-ACL reconstructive surgery (8 gel-pack, 12 computer-controlled cryotherapy).
effective_dosage: Treatment was administered continuously for 12 hours.
study_duration: 12 hours of cryotherapy, with temperature measurements taken for 16 hours post-surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to critically review the role of cryotherapy (regional hypothermia) in alleviating chemotherapy-induced mucocutaneous complications such as oral mucositis, alopecia, ocular toxicity, and onycholysis.
results_summary: The study found that regional hypothermia reduces the burden of chemotherapy-related oral mucositis, alopecia, ocular toxicity, and onycholysis, though limitations included the absence of blinded control groups and variable clinical endpoints. The intervention was well tolerated.
population_specificity: Cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and outcomes of focal cryotherapy as a management option for clinically localized prostate cancer.
results_summary: Focal cryotherapy showed comparable 5-year biochemical disease-free survival to whole gland treatments, with minimal complications and encouraging early cancer control outcomes. It may improve failure rates in men initially on active surveillance.
population_specificity: Men with clinically localized, low-risk prostate cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the impact of childhood cancer treatments, including cryotherapy, on dental development.
results_summary: The abstract mentions cryotherapy as an advanced treatment option for childhood cancers but does not provide specific results regarding its effects. It reports dental malformations in childhood cancer survivors, with a unique case of microdontia affecting all first premolars.
population_specificity: Childhood cancer survivors, particularly those treated during tooth formation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical features, treatment outcomes, and safety of various interventions, including cryotherapy, for ciliary body medulloepithelioma.
results_summary: Cryotherapy was used as a primary treatment in one case (3%) among 41 patients, but the abstract does not detail its specific efficacy or safety outcomes. The study primarily focused on broader treatment outcomes, with metastasis occurring in 8% of cases.
population_specificity: Forty-one patients (median age 5 years) diagnosed with ciliary body medulloepithelioma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of comprehensive cryosurgery combined with dendritic cell-cytokine-induced killer cell immunotherapy on overall survival in metastatic hepatocellular cancer patients.
